results.title: Love My Way: A Different Planet
results.creator_credit: Jessica Hobbs, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Foxtel, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Southern Star Entertainment and Louise Fox
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 8 first aired on Foxtel on 17th January 2005.

results.title: Crash Zone: No News is Good News
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Kevin Nemeth
results.brief_description:
The kids are alone at Catalyst and having a great time when Kimberley arrives. She’s a news reporter, there to do a story on the testers. Mike is flattered but the other kids begin to suspect she’s a spy. Pi finally succeeds in getting rid of Kimberley only to find her own mother has tracked her to Catalyst. Pi’s unmasked. Now everybody knows she’s a rich kid.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Undercover
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Alex’s valuable necklace goes missing at Catalyst and everyone is a suspect. Pi feels particularly that she needs to prove her innocence although Virgil’s idea of helping by downloading Detective Stories from the Net is making things more difficult. When Marcello’s little sister Sam is lost on the streets, the kids have two demanding cases on their hands.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Dream Team
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
A coded message on the Net becomes an irresistible puzzle for Mike, Pi, Bec, Marcello and Ram. Following the clues leads them to a meeting with Alexandra Davis, head of Software company Catalyst, and a job testing video games after school! The job of their dreams which brings unexpected surprises including the discovery of Virgil, a strange artificial intelligence loose on the Net.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Shadow
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Anthony Morris
results.brief_description:
Marcello throws Catalyst into uproar when he hacks into Alex’s system. Alex brings in legendary hacker-tracker J.D. Moon to find the security breach. Marcello is too scared to own up to his foolishness and as J.D. Moon gets closer to the truth, the kids have to choose whether to help Marcello or not. When Alex discovers the truth, she fires Marcello.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Heroes
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Kevin Nemeth
results.brief_description:
Marcello feels rejected when Alex dismisses his idea for a video game based on Virgil. Mike too is deflated when he finds that his hero, Stig MaCallister, creator of his favourite comic, is rude and aggressive. Tempted by an offer from Sunijim representative, Brad Kane, Marcello eventually realises Brad is an even bigger scammer than himself.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: It's Only Words
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Anthony Morris
results.brief_description:
A computer virus invades Catalyst and it’s a fight against the clock to save Alex’s game ‘Trillin’ and indeed, the whole of Catalyst. The kids are not at their best as there’s friction between Mike and Bec. Bec believes he should have stood up for her when his friends made racist comments to her. No matter how much Mike apologises, the team is edgy.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Big Business
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Max Dann
results.brief_description:
Marcello tries to make money selling Ram’s new invention. Ram, realising Marcello is ripping him off, dissolves the partnership and then sells one of his amazing new game converters to a strange girl, Louise. Unfortunately Louise’s TV blows up and she blames Ram. Will the other kids be able to save Ram before he becomes a meal for Louise’s huge dog, ‘Predator’?
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Secrets and Lies
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
Bec is intrigued and delighted by a ‘Net romance’ she’s pursuing. The boys are sceptical and their worst fears are realised when they find out it’s really Virgil writing love letters to Bec. Pi tries to think of a way to save Bec from the humiliation of finding out she’s romancing a program! How can she do this when her own lies are getting her deeper in trouble herself?
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Birthday
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Kevin Nemeth
results.brief_description:
Marcello’s unemployed father is acting strangely and Marcello believes he’s cracking up. While Bec has created her own game about gnomes, Marcello becomes convinced his father is going to kill himself. The kids, confused by Pi’s depression, Bec’s game and Marcello’s weirdness, are unsure exactly who is really cracking up.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.
